comment: Professor Hults is a great instructor. His teaching style is PowerPoint heavy, so be prepared for that. However, he doesn't just read the slides verbatim. He includes his own real-world experience with the concepts to help make it more understandable. If you have to take MGT 4001, register with professor Hults with confidence. Awesome guy.

Please take him ! He is an amazing professor. He cares about you and your grade! Gives a ton of extra credit ! 3 tests and a group project that is not hard. Just make sure you and your teammates are on it ! Just take him ! Easy A.

This class was pretty easy. Class was not mandatory, but he did take attendance periodically. You have a group project throughout the semester with multiple assignments. 3 Tests. Hults is pretty cool, but one thing is he does not hold students accountable for their faults so be careful with the group project. Overall, would take.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Hults was an excellent professor to have and truly helped me realize what kind of individual I want to be in my career. His behavioral management class offered way more than just what was on the powerpoints. The amount of life lessons and heartfelt content he gave us really made him stand out as a professor.

Dr. Hults is one of my favorite professors at KSU. He is the nicest guy and always willing to help in any scenario. Only grades are a few tests and a group project. All very easy to pass. No textbook needed.

Hults was an amazing professor and was one of my favorites due to his amazing want to teach his students. His entire goal is to make sure the students are successful but also makes the class amazingly easy. He takes random attendance checks but only about 5 times in the semester. There was an super easy group project that only took minimal effort!

In the best way, Professor Hults is an over qualified professor. He's had several high ranking jobs at Fortune 500 companies. This allows him to provide extremely interesting anecdotes about the course material. On top of that, he is an extremely fair grader and wants his students to do well. Tests are based on the textbook. Definitely recommend.

Grading structure is fairly straight forward. Just some pop quizzes that he lets you know about ahead of time, 3 online tests, group project that is simple and easier compared to other 3100 courses, and 2 case studies. Does take attendance at random. Lectures are for the most part engaging, Overall, it's an easy class.

Amazing prof, very engaging, and reasonable. There are "pop quizzes", but he usually lets you know ahead of time and they are easy. The tests are open book, so not too hard. The semester-long project is easy as long as everyone in your team is reasonably reliable. Not too much work, and easy grades. Connect was not a requirement. Definitely a gem.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: One of my favorite professors ever, extremely caring and nice, doesn't make anything harder than it is. Occasional pop-quiz in class, but are easy. Tests are online & non-proctored. He made a boring class into a useful one by using his own life experiences as a professional. Just an overall great guy. I wish I could have him for all classes. 10/10.
